WorkloadName.description:
The name of the workload.

The name must be unique within an account within an Amazon Web Services Region. Spaces and capitalization are ignored when checking for uniqueness.

AccountIds.description: The list of Amazon Web Services account IDs associated with the workload.

AwsRegions.description: The list of Amazon Web Services Regions associated with the workload, for example, us-east-2, or ca-central-1.

NonAwsRegions.description: The list of non-Amazon Web Services Regions associated with the workload.

PillarPriorities.description: The priorities of the pillars, which are used to order items in the improvement plan. Each pillar is represented by its PillarReviewSummary$PillarId.

ArchitecturalDesign.description: The URL of the architectural design for the workload.

ReviewOwner.description: The review owner of the workload. The name, email address, or identifier for the primary group or individual that owns the workload review process.

IsReviewOwnerUpdateAcknowledged.description:
Flag indicating whether the workload owner has acknowledged that the Review owner field is required.

If a Review owner is not added to the workload within 60 days of acknowledgement, access to the workload is restricted until an owner is added.

IndustryType.description:
The industry type for the workload.

If specified, must be one of the following:

  • Agriculture

  • Automobile

  • Defense

  • Design and Engineering

  • Digital Advertising

  • Education

  • Environmental Protection

  • Financial Services

  • Gaming

  • General Public Services

  • Healthcare

  • Hospitality

  • InfoTech

  • Justice and Public Safety

  • Life Sciences

  • Manufacturing

  • Media & Entertainment

  • Mining & Resources

  • Oil & Gas

  • Power & Utilities

  • Professional Services

  • Real Estate & Construction

  • Retail & Wholesale

  • Social Protection

  • Telecommunications

  • Travel, Transportation & Logistics

  • Other

Notes.description: The notes associated with the workload.

ImprovementStatus.description: The improvement status for a workload.

DiscoveryConfig.description: Discovery configuration associated to the workload.

allOf.description: Discovery integration status in respect to Trusted Advisor for the workload.

The mode to use for identifying resources associated with the workload.

You can specify WORKLOAD_METADATA, APP_REGISTRY, or both.

Applications.description: List of AppRegistry application ARNs to associate to the workload.

AwsAccountId.description: An Amazon Web Services account ID.

AwsRegion.description: An Amazon Web Services Region, for example, us-west-2 or ap-northeast-1.

PillarId.description:
The ID used to identify a pillar, for example, security.

A pillar is identified by its PillarReviewSummary$PillarId.

$block: Output of an update workload call.

$ul: **Workload**: A workload return object.
**WorkloadId**: The ID assigned to the workload. This ID is unique within an Amazon Web Services Region.
**WorkloadArn**: The ARN for the workload.

**WorkloadName**:

The name of the workload.

The name must be unique within an account within an Amazon Web Services Region. Spaces and capitalization are ignored when checking for uniqueness.
**Description**: The description for the workload.
**Environment**: The environment for the workload.
**UpdatedAt**: The date and time recorded.
**AccountIds**: The list of Amazon Web Services account IDs associated with the workload.
**AwsRegions**: The list of Amazon Web Services Regions associated with the workload, for example, us-east-2, or ca-central-1.
**NonAwsRegions**:  The list of non-Amazon Web Services Regions associated with the workload.
**ArchitecturalDesign**: The URL of the architectural design for the workload.
**ReviewOwner**: The review owner of the workload. The name, email address, or identifier for the primary group or individual that owns the workload review process.
**ReviewRestrictionDate**: The date and time recorded.
**IsReviewOwnerUpdateAcknowledged**

**IndustryType**:

The industry type for the workload.

If specified, must be one of the following:

  • Agriculture

  • Automobile

  • Defense

  • Design and Engineering

  • Digital Advertising

  • Education

  • Environmental Protection

**Industry**: The industry for the workload.
**Notes**: The notes associated with the workload.
**ImprovementStatus**: The improvement status for a workload.
**RiskCounts**: A map from risk names to the count of how many questions have that rating.
**PillarPriorities**: The priorities of the pillars, which are used to order items in the improvement plan. Each pillar is represented by its PillarReviewSummary$PillarId.
**Lenses**: The list of lenses associated with the workload. Each lens is identified by its LensSummary$LensAlias.
**Owner**: An Amazon Web Services account ID.
**ShareInvitationId**
**Tags**
**DiscoveryConfig**
**Applications**
**Profiles**
**PrioritizedRiskCounts**: A map from risk names to the count of how many questions have that rating.
